name: DSE ICT - Database Assessment
subject: ICT
instructions: This rubric is used to assess database-related questions in HKDSE ICT, including SQL queries, ERD design, and normalization.

levels.descriptor: SQL syntax is completely correct. All keywords, clauses, and operators used appropriately. Query would execute without errors.
SQL syntax is mostly correct. Minor errors that would not prevent query execution.
SQL syntax has some errors. Query may not execute correctly but shows understanding.
SQL syntax has significant errors. Limited understanding demonstrated.
SQL syntax is largely incorrect or missing.
Query logic correctly addresses the requirement. Appropriate use of JOINs, WHERE clauses, GROUP BY, etc. Returns correct result set.
Query logic is mostly correct. May have minor issues with result set.
Query logic partially addresses requirement. Some issues with JOINs or filtering.
Query logic has significant issues. Does not produce correct results.
Query logic is fundamentally flawed or missing.
Database design follows normalization principles. Appropriate use of primary and foreign keys. Relationships correctly identified. ERD notation is correct.
Database design is mostly normalized. Keys identified correctly. Minor issues with relationships.
Database design shows some normalization. Some issues with keys or relationships.
Database design has significant normalization issues. Keys or relationships incorrect.
Database design is poor or missing.

commonErrors: Confusing INNER JOIN with OUTER JOIN
Using WHERE instead of HAVING with aggregates
Missing semicolon at end of query
